statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Cent. Connecticut St. 103, Sacred Heart 96, OT
article.headline: Cent. Connecticut St. 103, Sacred Heart 96, OT
article.linkText: Cent. Connecticut St. 103, Sacred Heart 96, OT
article.story: NEW BRITAIN, Conn. (AP) -- Tristan Blackwood scored 29 of his 32 points after halftime as Central Connecticut rallied from 19 points down to earn a 103-96 overtime victory over Sacred Heart on Saturday. The win gave the Blue Devils (11-10, 8-1 Northeast Conference) sole possession of first place in the conference. The teams traded 3-pointers to start overtime, but Drew Shubik's triple put the Pioneers up 93-90. Central eventually rallied to tie it at 95-95 on a Blackwood three with 2:27 left. Jemino Sobers' free throw put Central up by one with 1:49 to go, and Blackwood hit a huge 3-pointer from the left corner to make it 99-95 with 40 seconds to go. Central made its free throws down the stretch to finish the job. Javier Mojica had 23 points for the Blue Devils, and Obie Nwadike added 22 points and 11 rebounds. Sacred Heart (10-9, 6-2) was led by Jarrid Frye's 19 points, 17 of which came after halftime. The Pioneers built a 53-34 lead in the second half before Central rallied. Central took its first lead of the game, 86-85, when Blackwood laid one in with 54.5 seconds left in regulation. Joey Hanley's floater put Sacred Heart back up by one with 36.2 seconds left, but Mojica forced overtime by making one of two free throws with 3.8 seconds left.
